translated: Śrī-Jambhala-sādhana

original: bod skad du /

translated: In Tibetan:

original: dpal dzam bha la'i sgrub thabs /
analyzed: dpal dzam bha la'i sgrub thabs /
translated: The Means of Achieving Glorious Jambhala

original: dzam bha la la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: dzam bha la la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to Jambhala.

original: dang por re zhig gnas kyi don thams cad dang rang gi lus kyang stong bar bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: dang por re zhig gnas kyi don thams cad dang rang gi lus kyang stong bar bsgom pa'o //
translated: First, one should meditate on the meaning of the place and also one's own body as empty.

original: de'i rjes la cung zad dmar ba'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin nyid gnod sbyin gyi shing rta gru gsum padma 'dab ma brgyad pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes la cung zad dmar ba'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin nyid gnod sbyin gyi shing rta gru gsum padma 'dab ma brgyad pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: After that, on a moon mandala slightly reddish in color, one should visualize the nature of method and wisdom itself in the form of a three-cornered yakṣa chariot with eight lotus petals.

original: de'i dbus su bam yig las nor rgyun ma sku mdog ser mo phyag na 'bras kyi snye ma dang mchog sbyin mdzad pa /
analyzed: de'i dbus su bam yig las nor rgyun ma sku mdog ser mo phyag na 'bras kyi snye ma dang mchog sbyin mdzad pa /
translated: In the center of that, from the syllable vaṃ, one should visualize Vasudharā, yellow in color, holding a rice ear and making the gesture of granting wishes.

original: rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /
translated: She is adorned with all ornaments.

original: gnod sbyin mo brgyad kyis yongs su bskor ba 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gnod sbyin mo brgyad kyis yongs su bskor ba 'di lta ste /
translated: She is surrounded by eight yakṣiṇīs, namely:

original: bzang mo dang / rab tu bzang mo dang / sbas ma dang / rab tu sbas ma dang / lha mo dang / dbyangs can ma dang / 'phags ma dang @241a * //
analyzed: bzang mo dang / rab tu bzang mo dang / sbas ma dang / rab tu sbas ma dang / lha mo dang / dbyangs can ma dang / 'phags ma dang @241a * //
translated: Bhadra, Subhadra, Guhya, Subguhya, Devī, Sarasvatī, Āryā,

original: chu shel ma rnams kyis yongs su bskor ba'o //
analyzed: chu shel ma rnams kyis yongs su bskor ba'o //
translated: and Jyotiṣmatī.

original: lha mo chen mo de'i bha ga'i dbus su /
analyzed: lha mo chen mo de'i bha ga'i dbus su /
translated: In the center of the bhaga of that great goddess,

original: dzam yig gi bdag nyid sangs rgyas lnga'i cod pan can /
analyzed: dzam yig gi bdag nyid sangs rgyas lnga'i cod pan can /
translated: the syllable jam, which is the nature of the five buddhas, with a crown of five buddhas,

original: phyag g-yas na b'i dza p'u ra ka / g-yon na ne'u le bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: phyag g-yas na b'i dza p'u ra ka / g-yon na ne'u le bsnams pa'o //
translated: holding a water pot in the right hand and a mongoose in the left hand.🔽The five tathāgatas are raining down a great treasure of various jewels upon the head of the conch-bearer and the head of the lotus-bearer, upon whom he stands with two feet.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lngas rin po che sna tshogs pa'i char 'bebs bzhin pa dung can gyi mgo dang / padma can gyi mgo'i gter chen po la zhabs gnyis bzhugs pa rang gi khang pa'i phyogs gcig tu bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lngas rin po che sna tshogs pa'i char 'bebs bzhin pa dung can gyi mgo dang / padma can gyi mgo'i gter chen po la zhabs gnyis bzhugs pa rang gi khang pa'i phyogs gcig tu bsam par bya'o //
translated: One should visualize him in one corner of one's own house.

original: sku mdog ser bo autpa la sngon po'i phreng ba bsnams pa'i dpal ldan mgon po dzam bha la nor rgyun ma la yang dag par 'khyud pa /
analyzed: sku mdog ser bo autpa la sngon po'i phreng ba bsnams pa'i dpal ldan mgon po dzam bha la nor rgyun ma la yang dag par 'khyud pa /
translated: The glorious protector Jambhala, yellow in color, holding a garland of blue lotuses, perfectly embracing Vasudharā,

original: byang chub sems kyi thig le las skyes pa'i rin po che'i tshogs kyis nam mkha' ma lus par khyab par bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems kyi thig le las skyes pa'i rin po che'i tshogs kyis nam mkha' ma lus par khyab par bsgom par bya ste /
translated: One should meditate on the sky being filled with a collection of jewels born from the bindu of bodhicitta.🔽At the time of the descent, one should meditate on the following:

original: 'bab pa'i dus su shar phyogs su gang ba bzang po sngon po /
analyzed: 'bab pa'i dus su shar phyogs su gang ba bzang po sngon po /
translated: In the east, there is the blue Bhadra, who is filled with jewels.

original: lho phyogs su rnam thos sras ser po /
analyzed: lho phyogs su rnam thos sras ser po /
translated: In the south, there is the yellow Vaiśravaṇa.

original: nub phyogs su nor sbyin dmar po'o //
analyzed: nub phyogs su nor sbyin dmar po'o //
translated: In the west, there is the red Kubera.

original: byang phyogs su nor bu bzang po ser po'o //🔽me'i mtshams su tsi pi kunda li dmar po /
analyzed: byang phyogs su nor bu bzang po ser po'o // me'i mtshams su tsi pi kunda li dmar po /
translated: In the north, there is the yellow Maṇibhadra.🔽In the southeast, there is the red Cīpikaṇṭhī.

original: bden bral du ki li mi li sngon po /🔽rlung du spyod pa'i dbang po ser po /
analyzed: bden bral du ki li mi li sngon po / rlung du spyod pa'i dbang po ser po /
translated: In the southwest, there is the blue Kilikilī.🔽In the northwest, there is the yellow Indreśvara.

original: dbang ldan du kha'i dbang po ser po'o //
analyzed: dbang ldan du kha'i dbang po ser po'o //
translated: In the northeast, there is the yellow Mukhyeśvara.

original: de thams cad kyang nor sbyin mo'i bha ga'i dbus na gnas pa'i rin po che'i char 'bebs bzhin pa'i dzam bha la bzhin du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de thams cad kyang nor sbyin mo'i bha ga'i dbus na gnas pa'i rin po che'i char 'bebs bzhin pa'i dzam bha la bzhin du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: All of them are like Jambhala, who is in the center of the bhaga of Vasudharā, and is raining jewels.

original: shar sgor gnod sbyin chen po gcer bu 'bras bu 'chang ba rin po che'i char 'bebs pa'o //
analyzed: shar sgor gnod sbyin chen po gcer bu 'bras bu 'chang ba rin po che'i char 'bebs pa'o //
translated: At the eastern gate, there is the great yakṣa Nirbhāsadhārin, who rains jewels.

original: lho sgor padma dang padma chen po dag go //
analyzed: lho sgor padma dang padma chen po dag go //
translated: At the southern gate are Padma and Mahāpadma.

original: nub sgor ki li dang ma h'a ki li dag go //
analyzed: nub sgor ki li dang ma h'a ki li dag go //
translated: At the western gate are Kili and Mahākili.

original: byang sgor gang ba dang gang ba bzang po dag go //
analyzed: byang sgor gang ba dang gang ba bzang po dag go //
translated: At the northern gate are Pūrṇa and Subhadra.

original: de dag rnams kyang gcer bu 'bras bu 'chang ba'o //
analyzed: de dag rnams kyang gcer bu 'bras bu 'chang ba'o //
translated: They are all naked and hold a fruit.

original: mgon po dzam bha la la go rims bzhin du sngags kyi yi ge rnams dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: mgon po dzam bha la la go rims bzhin du sngags kyi yi ge rnams dgod par bya'o //
translated: The mantra syllables are to be placed on Lord Jambhala in order.

original: aom ni spyi bor ro //
analyzed: aom ni spyi bor ro //
translated: Om is on the head.

original: dzam ni zhal la'o //
analyzed: dzam ni zhal la'o //
translated: Jam is on the face.

original: bha la ni phyag gnyis la'o //
analyzed: bha la ni phyag gnyis la'o //
translated: Bhal is on the two hands.

original: dza thugs kar ro //
analyzed: dza thugs kar ro //
translated: Ja is on the heart.

original: len lte ba la'o //🔽dr'a ya ni brla gnyis la'o //
analyzed: len lte ba la'o // dr'a ya ni brla gnyis la'o //
translated: Len is on the navel.🔽Draya is on the two thighs.

original: sv'a h'a ni pus mo gnyis la'o //
analyzed: sv'a h'a ni pus mo gnyis la'o //
translated: Svāhā is on the two knees.

original: spyi bor nor bu bzang po'o //
analyzed: spyi bor nor bu bzang po'o //
translated: On the head is Maṇibhadra.

original: spyan gnyis la rnam thos sras so //
analyzed: spyan gnyis la rnam thos sras so //
translated: On the two eyes is Vaiśravaṇa.

original: kha la mu khendra'o //🔽nu ma'i bar du gang ba bzang po'o //
analyzed: kha la mu khendra'o // nu ma'i bar du gang ba bzang po'o //
translated: On the mouth is Mukhīndra.🔽Between the breasts is Pūrṇabhadra.

original: lte bar nor sbyin no //
analyzed: lte bar nor sbyin no //
translated: On the navel is Vasudatta.

original: brla gnyis la ki li mi li'o //
analyzed: brla gnyis la ki li mi li'o //
translated: On the two thighs is Kilimi.

original: rkang pa dag la tsi pi kunda li'o //
analyzed: rkang pa dag la tsi pi kunda li'o //
translated: On the feet is Cīpikuṇḍali.

original: yan lag @241b thams cad la tsa rendra'o //
analyzed: yan lag @241b thams cad la tsa rendra'o //
translated: On all the limbs is Carendra.

original: da ni yi ge dgod par bya'o //🔽aom spyi bor ro //
analyzed: da ni yi ge dgod par bya'o // aom spyi bor ro //
translated: Now, the syllables should be placed.🔽Om at the crown.

original: dzlum dpral bar ro //
analyzed: dzlum dpral bar ro //
translated: Jlum at the forehead.

original: tslum rna ba dag la'o //
analyzed: tslum rna ba dag la'o //
translated: Clum on the ears.

original: sam mgo bo'i rgyab tu dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: sam mgo bo'i rgyab tu dgod par bya'o //
translated: Sam should be placed on the back of the head.

original: da ni lag pa la dgod par bya ba ste /
analyzed: da ni lag pa la dgod par bya ba ste /
translated: Now, they should be placed on the hands.

original: lha rnams kyi yi ge aom mkhrig mgul du /
analyzed: lha rnams kyi yi ge aom mkhrig mgul du /
translated: The syllable Om of the gods is on the wrist.

original: dzlum lag pa'i dbus su /🔽tslum sor mo thams cad kyi rtse mo la /
analyzed: dzlum lag pa'i dbus su / tslum sor mo thams cad kyi rtse mo la /
translated: Jlum is in the middle of the hand.🔽Clum is on the tips of all the fingers.

original: sam sor mo thams cad kyi rtsa ba la'o //
analyzed: sam sor mo thams cad kyi rtsa ba la'o //
translated: Sam is at the base of all the fingers.

original: aom dzam bha la dza lendra ye sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom dzam bha la dza lendra ye sv'a h'a /
translated: Om Jambhala Jalen-draya Svaha.

original: zhes pas rab tu gnas par bya'o //🔽mdzub mo la nor bu bzang po /
analyzed: zhes pas rab tu gnas par bya'o // mdzub mo la nor bu bzang po /
translated: With this, one should consecrate.🔽On the index finger is Sudhana.

original: gung mo la gang ba bzang po /🔽ming med la nor sbyin /
analyzed: gung mo la gang ba bzang po / ming med la nor sbyin /
translated: On the middle finger is Purnabhadra.🔽On the ring finger is Vasudhara.

original: mthe'u chung la rnam sras /
analyzed: mthe'u chung la rnam sras /
translated: On the little finger is Vinayaka.

original: de bzhin du kha'i dbang po lag pa'i mthil du ;🔽mkhrig mgul du ki li mi li /
analyzed: de bzhin du kha'i dbang po lag pa'i mthil du ; mkhrig mgul du ki li mi li /
translated: In the same way, on the palm of the hand is the organ of the mouth.🔽On the wrist is Kili-milim.

original: mtheb chen la tsi pi kunda li /
analyzed: mtheb chen la tsi pi kunda li /
translated: On the thumb is Cipikundali.

original: mdzub mo dang bcas pa'i mtheb chen gyi bar du tsa rendra'o //
analyzed: mdzub mo dang bcas pa'i mtheb chen gyi bar du tsa rendra'o //
translated: Between the thumb and the index finger is Carendra.

original: lag pa'i dbus su dzam bha la dza lendr'a'o //
analyzed: lag pa'i dbus su dzam bha la dza lendr'a'o //
translated: In the middle of the hand is Jambhala Jālinīprabha.

original: rdo rje'i chu la sogs pa'i bdud rtsi lnga de'i ngo bo ma yin kyang /
analyzed: rdo rje'i chu la sogs pa'i bdud rtsi lnga de'i ngo bo ma yin kyang /
translated: The five ambrosias such as vajra water are not of his nature.

original: rdo rje chu dang chu ba sres nas khyor bas btung ste /
analyzed: rdo rje chu dang chu ba sres nas khyor bas btung ste /
translated: However, having mixed the vajra water with water, one should drink it with a ladle.

original: khyor ba brgya rtsa brgyad thun mtshams gsum du dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: khyor ba brgya rtsa brgyad thun mtshams gsum du dbul bar bya'o //
translated: One should offer one hundred and eight ladles in three sessions.

original: ring por mi thogs par dzam bha la dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ring por mi thogs par dzam bha la dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One will become like Jambhala in no long time.

original: nor dang gser 'phel zhing sa gzhi rdzas kyis yongs su gang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nor dang gser 'phel zhing sa gzhi rdzas kyis yongs su gang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Wealth and gold will increase, and the ground will be filled with substances.

original: aom dzlum tslum sam zhes brjod cing chu khyor bas dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: aom dzlum tslum sam zhes brjod cing chu khyor bas dbul bar bya'o //
translated: One should offer water with a ladle, saying “Oṃ jlum clum sam.”

original: grub par ma gyur na dpal rdo rje h'um mdzad du bdag nyid bsgoms la dzam bha la'i sku gzugs la dug dang ske tshe dang nim pa'i lo ma dang / dha du ra dang / dur khrod kyi sol bas byugs la bsro zhing skam par bya'o //
analyzed: grub par ma gyur na dpal rdo rje h'um mdzad du bdag nyid bsgoms la dzam bha la'i sku gzugs la dug dang ske tshe dang nim pa'i lo ma dang / dha du ra dang / dur khrod kyi sol bas byugs la bsro zhing skam par bya'o //
translated: If one does not succeed, one should meditate on oneself as glorious Vajra Hūṃkara and smear the image of Jambhala with poison, black mustard seed, neem leaves, dhatūra, and charnel ground ash, and fumigate and dry it.

original: phyi nas dur khrod kyi me la khros pas bdugs na des par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyi nas dur khrod kyi me la khros pas bdugs na des par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one fumigates it later with the charnel ground fire, it will certainly be accomplished.

original: dpal ldan dzam bha la'i sgrub thabs rdzogs so//
analyzed: dpal ldan dzam bha la'i sgrub thabs rdzogs so//
translated: The sādhana of glorious Jambhala is complete.
